newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Innogenetics Easdaq IPO price fixed at $12 a share.
newsitem.headline: Innogenetics Easdaq IPO price fixed at $12 a share.

text.p: Belgian biotechnology firm Innogenetics said on Wednesday the price of shares in its initial public offering on Europe's new Easdaq growth stocks market was fixed at $12 each.

Subscriptions closed on November 25. The shares will start trading on Easdaq on Thursday. The issue was oversubscribed five times. In total 7,492,824 shares would be issued, according to a statement published in Belgian financial newspapers.
Innogenetics had originally offered up to 6,658,050 shares, or 32 percent of its issued capital.
Easdaq became technically operational on September 30, but trading did not start until today, Wednesday, with U.K.-based anti-virus software firm Dr Solomon's.
By 1145 GMT Dr Solomon's was quoted at $17.125 per American depositary share, up from its listing and opening price of $17.
